title: Photosynthesis: How Plants Make Food
description: Explore the amazing process of photosynthesis! Students will learn how plants use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to create food and oxygen.
subject: atom_sphere

template_data.instructions: Answer these questions about photosynthesis. Think about what plants need and what they produce!

questions.prompt: What is the main purpose of photosynthesis?
choices: To make food (glucose) for the plant
expected: To make food (glucose) for the plant
questions.hint: Think about what plants need to survive and grow
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process plants use to make their own food (glucose) using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide.

questions.prompt: Which part of the plant cell is where photosynthesis happens?
questions.hint: This organelle contains chlorophyll and is green
questions.explanation: Chloroplasts contain chlorophyll and are the site of photosynthesis in plant cells.

questions.prompt: What gives plants their green color?
questions.explanation: Chlorophyll is a green pigment that absorbs light energy for photosynthesis.

questions.prompt: Which THREE things do plants need for photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Plants need sunlight (energy), water (H₂O), and carbon dioxide (CO₂) to perform photosynthesis.

questions.prompt: What TWO things do plants produce during photosynthesis?
questions.hint: One is food for the plant, one is what we breathe
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis produces glucose (C₆H₁₂O₆) which is food for the plant, and oxygen (O₂) which is released into the air.

questions.prompt: Where do plants get the carbon dioxide they need?
choices: From the soil through their roots
From the air through tiny holes in their leaves
expected: From the air through tiny holes in their leaves
questions.hint: Think about stomata - tiny pores in leaves
questions.explanation: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air through tiny pores called stomata, mainly found on the underside of leaves.

questions.prompt: Why is photosynthesis important for animals and humans?
choices: It makes the air smell nice
It produces oxygen that we need to breathe
expected: It produces oxygen that we need to breathe
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis produces oxygen as a byproduct, which is essential for animals and humans to breathe.

questions.prompt: What is the chemical formula for glucose (the sugar plants make)?
questions.hint: It contains carbon (C), hydrogen (H), and oxygen (O)
questions.explanation: Glucose has the chemical formula C₆H₁₂O₆ - it contains 6 carbon, 12 hydrogen, and 6 oxygen atoms.

choices: Only during the day when there is sunlight
All the time, day and night
expected: Only during the day when there is sunlight
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis requires sunlight, so it only occurs during the day when light is available. At night, plants only respire.

questions.prompt: What happens to most of the oxygen produced during photosynthesis?
choices: It is released into the air
expected: It is released into the air
questions.hint: This is why forests are called the 'lungs of the Earth'
questions.explanation: Most of the oxygen produced during photosynthesis is released into the atmosphere through the stomata.

questions.prompt: What would happen to a plant if it was kept in complete darkness?
choices: It would not be able to perform photosynthesis and would eventually die
expected: It would not be able to perform photosynthesis and would eventually die
questions.hint: Remember, sunlight is one of the key ingredients
questions.explanation: Without sunlight, a plant cannot perform photosynthesis to make food, so it would use up its stored energy and eventually die.

questions.prompt: The word 'photosynthesis' comes from Greek words meaning:
questions.explanation: 'Photo' means light and 'synthesis' means putting together - literally 'making with light'.
